thread.title: St. Anthony edges Teutopolis, both advance to sectionals
thread.title_full: St. Anthony edges Teutopolis, both advance to sectionals

author: Ryan Czachorski Daily News
title: St. Anthony edges Teutopolis, both advance to sectionals
text:
St. Anthony edges Teutopolis, both advance to sectionals Windsor/Stew-Stras' Warner, Altamont's Miller & Mayhaus move on 
The St. Anthony Bulldogs pose with their Class 1A Robinson Regional championship Tuesday. Posted: Tuesday, October 6, 2015 7:57 pm St. Anthony edges Teutopolis, both advance to sectionals Ryan Czachorski Daily News Effingham Daily News 
St. Anthony was pushed by county foe Teutopolis, but the Bulldogs bested the Wooden Shoes to win the Class 1A Robinson Regional. 
The Bulldogs shot a 329 and edged out Teutopolis' 334, while Robinson grabbed the third spot at sectionals with a 358. Altamont finished fourth with a score of 366. 
It was a close round at the top for the Bulldogs and the Wooden Shoes. 
"It was a little bit tighter, Teutopolis' boys played really, really well," said St. Anthony coach Phil Zaccari. "It was a little shaky at the end there." 
Jared Hutchison carded a 78 for St. Anthony, and Niko Dust shot an 80 for the second-lowest and third-lowest rounds of the day behind Robinson's Tom Goodman, who shot a 76 for the medal. Jeff Niebrugge shot an 85 for eighth, and Luke Ludwig finished 12th with an 86. 
For Teutopolis, Christian Deters tied for fourth with an 81 and Dylan Buenker shot an 82 for sixth. Keegan Meyer came in with an 85 for eighth and Mat Weber tied Ludwig for 12th with an 86. The Shoes thought they could compete with St. Anthony after finishing nine strokes back at the Windsor Invitational. 
"We just about had them, our goal was to show up and compete today, and we definitely did that," said Teutopolis coach Lewis Martin. "These past few weeks, we've been playing pretty good golf. 
"Christian, Dylan, my one and two guys, we expected some good scores out of those two. They could have had a little better of a day today. Mat, I was really happy with, I think that's one of his lower finishes. We kept griding today and never gave up." 
Martin said that this was the second time the Teutopolis boys have finished in the top three and made sectionals, th other being in 2013 with a third-place finish. 
While Altamont came up just short, the Indians will send two to sectionals. Adam Mayhaus and Dylan Miller both shot 89s for the sixth and seventh individual slots. 
For the other Indians' scores, Cameron Jackman shot a 93 and Grant Schmidt shot a 95. Coach John Niebrugge was happy with his advancing individuals, but thought the third spot was something they could have achieved coming in. 
"We knew St. Anthony was there and T-Town, we assumed they might be a one-two; I thought that third spot was kind of open," Niebrugge said. "Losing by eight shots, the boys were a little disappointed as a team. 
"I know Dylan and Adam were pretty happy, that's the bittersweet part about golf, it's team and individual. Adam would probably tell you straight face he didn't shoot his best, he's happy to move on as an individual, but on the team front, he wishes could have carried the weight on his shoulders a little more." 
The Bulldogs, the Shoes, and Mayhaus and Miller will move on to Monday's Class 1A Anna-Jonesboro Sectional at Union County Country Club. 
It's the 10th-straight regional crown for St. Anthony, and Zaccari thinks they could cut a few shots off going forward. 
"Jared had one bad hole, but other than that, played flawless. Niko was solid all round," he said. "I think we can do better all around, Jeff and Luke could have shaved three or four strokes off their round, but I'm pretty happy with it." 
RESULTS 
1. St. Anthony 329, 2.Teutopolis 334, 3. Robinson 358, 4. Altamont 366, 5. CCORL 381, 6. Flora 387, 7. Oblong 401, 8. Vandalia 403, 9. Ramsey 409, 10. Marshall 411, 11. Casey-Westfield 426 
St. Anthony: Hutchison 78; Dust 80; Niebrugge 85; Ludwig 86 
Teutopolis: Deters 81; Buenker 82; Meyer 85; M. Weber 86 
Altamont: Mayhaus 89; Miller 89; Jackman 93; Schmidt 95 
Medalist: Goodman (R) 76 
Advancing indivudals: Wessel (CCORL) 81; Shulman (V) 84; Kimmell (F) 85; Palm (CCORL) 85; Reiss (R) 87; Mayhaus (A) 89; Miller (A) 89; Trotter (F) 90; Bates (Sandoval) 91; Johnson (O) 92 
Warner moves on 
Windsor/Stew-Stras hosted the Class 1A Windsor Regional at Fox Prairie Golf Course, and sent one golfer on to sectionals. 
Tristan Warner shot an 80 for the Hatchets, the second-best score among individuals, to advance to the Class 1A El Paso-Gridley Sectional Monday. 
Warner was four shots behind medalist Clayton Miller of Arcola, who carded a 76. 
The Hatchets finished seventh, with a team score of 389. Sullivan won in a tiebreaker of Arcola, both shooting 346s, and Okaw Valley moved on with a 362. 
Full team scores for Windsor/Stew-Stras were not made available as of press time. Neoga was scheduled to play at the event, but no score for Luke Baker was made available by the IHSA. 
RESULTS 
1. Sullivan 346, 2. Arcola 346, 3. Okaw Valley 362, 4. Shelbyville 369, 5. Pana 371, 6. Decatur St. Teresa 371, 7. Windsor/Stew-Stras 389, 8. Oakland 393, 9. Tuscola 405, 10. Macon Meridian 417, 11. Villa Grove 430 
Medalist: Miller (A) 76 
Advancing individuals: Brilley (DST) 79; Richardson (O) 80; Warner (WSS) 80; Ta. Schanks (SH) 83; Ty. Schanks (SH) 83; Kinsella (Bement) 86; Babcock (MM) 86; Bland (Pana) 86; Richards (VG) 87; Thomas (T) 91
